critique: This document establishes a board to investigate a dispute between Eastern Air Lines and its employees. It aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to be a fairly neutral intervention to resolve a labor dispute. The order doesn't obviously expand executive power, but uses existing authority under the Railway Labor Act. It doesn't directly address federalism or social inclusion. It could be seen as a moderate intervention in the economy to prevent disruption.
